content: Singaporean electoral district (1980–2006) **Ayer Rajah Single Member Constituency** (SMC) was a [single member constituency](/wiki/Single_member_constituency) in Singapore that existed from 1980 to 2006. The SMC had only one Member of Parliament, [Tan Cheng Bock](/wiki/Tan_Cheng_Bock), of the [People's Action Party](/wiki/People%27s_Action_Party) from the creation of the SMC till its abolishment. ## History **Ayer Rajah Constituency** was first formed during the [1980 general election](/wiki/1980_Singaporean_general_election). In 1988, following the establishment of [Group representation constituency](/wiki/Group_representation_constituency) (GRC) and SMC, it was known as Ayer Rajah Single Member Constituency. Ayer Rajah SMC was made up of [Pandan Gardens](/wiki/Pandan_Gardens) estate, [Teban Gardens](/wiki/Teban_Gardens) estate, parts of [Jurong East New Town](/wiki/Jurong_East_New_Town) and [Clementi West New Town](/wiki/West_Coast,_Singapore). In 2006, prior to the [2006 general election](/wiki/2006_Singaporean_general_election), it was absorbed into the [West Coast GRC](/wiki/West_Coast_Group_Representation_Constituency). ## Member of Parliament **Year** **Member****Party****Formation**(/wiki/1980_Singaporean_general_election)[Tan Cheng Bock](/wiki/Tan_Cheng_Bock)[PAP](/wiki/People%27s_Action_Party)(/wiki/1984_Singaporean_general_election)(/wiki/1988_Singaporean_general_election)(/wiki/1991_Singaporean_general_election)(/wiki/1997_Singaporean_general_election)(/wiki/2001_Singaporean_general_election)**Constituency abolished (2006)** ## Electoral results Note: The [Elections Department](/wiki/Elections_Department_Singapore) does not include rejected votes when calculating the vote shares of candidates. Hence, all candidates' vote shares will total to 100% at any given election (may not appear so in multi-way contests due to rounding). ### Elections in 1980s [General Election
